verses.kjv: And the word of the LORD came unto me, saying,
verses.web: LORD’s word came to me, saying,
verses.ct: The word of the LORD came to me:

verses.kjv: Son of man, set thy face toward the mountains of Israel, and prophesy against them,
verses.web: “Son of man, set your face toward the mountains of Israel, and prophesy to them,
verses.ct: "Son of man, turn and face the mountains of Israel and prophesy against them.

verses.kjv: And say, Ye mountains of Israel, hear the word of the Lord GOD; Thus saith the Lord GOD to the mountains, and to the hills, to the rivers, and to the valleys; Behold, I, even I, will bring a sword upon you, and I will destroy your high places.
verses.web: and say, ‘You mountains of Israel, hear the word of the Lord LORD! The Lord LORD says to the mountains and to the hills, to the watercourses and to the valleys: “Behold, I, even I, will bring a sword on you, and I will destroy your high places.
verses.ct: Say to them: 'Mountains of Israel, hear the word of the Lord GOD! This is what the Lord GOD says to the mountains and hills, to the ravines and valleys: I myself am bringing a sword against you, and I will destroy your high places.

verses.kjv: And your altars shall be desolate, and your images shall be broken: and I will cast down your slain men before your idols.
verses.web: Your altars will become desolate, and your incense altars will be broken. I will cast down your slain men before your idols.
verses.ct: Your altars will be left in ruins, and your incense altars will be smashed to pieces. I will throw your dead right in front of your idols.

verses.kjv: And I will lay the dead carcases of the children of Israel before their idols; and I will scatter your bones round about your altars.
verses.web: I will lay the dead bodies of the children of Israel before their idols. I will scatter your bones around your altars.
verses.ct: I will pile the corpses of the people of Israel in front of their idols and scatter their bones all around their altars.

verses.kjv: In all your dwellingplaces the cities shall be laid waste, and the high places shall be desolate; that your altars may be laid waste and made desolate, and your idols may be broken and cease, and your images may be cut down, and your works may be abolished.
verses.web: In all your dwelling places, the cities will be laid waste and the high places will be desolate; that your altars may be laid waste and made desolate, and your idols may be broken and cease, and your incense altars may be cut down, and your works may be abolished.
verses.ct: Everywhere you live, the cities will be demolished and the high places torn down. Your altars will be wrecked and abandoned, your idols shattered and gone, your incense altars chopped down, and everything you made wiped out.

verses.kjv: And the slain shall fall in the midst of you, and ye shall know that I am the LORD.
verses.web: The slain will fall among you, and you will know that I am LORD.
verses.ct: The dead will drop all around you, and then you will know that I am the LORD.

verses.kjv: Yet will I leave a remnant, that ye may have some that shall escape the sword among the nations, when ye shall be scattered through the countries.
verses.web: “ ‘ “Yet I will leave a remnant, in that you will have some that escape the sword among the nations, when you are scattered through the countries.
verses.ct: "'But I will spare a remnant. Some of you will escape the sword and be scattered among the nations, exiled across foreign lands.

verses.kjv: And they that escape of you shall remember me among the nations whither they shall be carried captives, because I am broken with their whorish heart, which hath departed from me, and with their eyes, which go a whoring after their idols: and they shall lothe themselves for the evils which they have committed in all their abominations.
verses.web: Those of you that escape will remember me among the nations where they are carried captive, how I have been broken with their lewd heart, which has departed from me, and with their eyes, which play the prostitute after their idols. Then they will loathe themselves in their own sight for the evils which they have committed in all their abominations.
verses.ct: Those who survive will remember me in the nations where they've been taken captive. They'll understand how their unfaithful hearts broke me — hearts that turned away from me — and how their eyes chased after idols like a prostitute chases lovers. They will be disgusted with themselves for all the evil and detestable things they did.

verses.kjv: And they shall know that I am the LORD, and that I have not said in vain that I would do this evil unto them.
verses.web: They will know that I am LORD. I have not said in vain that I would do this evil to them.” ’
verses.ct: Then they will know that I am the LORD, and that my warnings about bringing this disaster on them were not empty words.'"

verses.kjv: Thus saith the Lord GOD; Smite with thine hand, and stamp with thy foot, and say, Alas for all the evil abominations of the house of Israel! for they shall fall by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence.
verses.web: “The Lord LORD says: ‘Strike with your hand, and stamp with your foot, and say, “Alas!” Because of all the evil abominations of the house of Israel; for they will fall by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence.
verses.ct: This is what the Lord GOD says: "Clap your hands and stomp your feet and cry out, 'What horror!' — because of all the wicked, detestable practices of the people of Israel. They will fall by the sword, by famine, and by plague.

verses.kjv: He that is far off shall die of the pestilence; and he that is near shall fall by the sword; and he that remaineth and is besieged shall die by the famine: thus will I accomplish my fury upon them.
verses.web: He who is far off will die of the pestilence. He who is near will fall by the sword. He who remains and is besieged will die by the famine. Thus I will accomplish my wrath on them.
verses.ct: Those far away will die of plague. Those nearby will fall by the sword. Those who survive and are trapped under siege will die of famine. That is how I will pour out my fury on them.

verses.kjv: Then shall ye know that I am the LORD, when their slain men shall be among their idols round about their altars, upon every high hill, in all the tops of the mountains, and under every green tree, and under every thick oak, the place where they did offer sweet savour to all their idols.
verses.web: You will know that I am LORD, when their slain men are among their idols around their altars, on every high hill, on all the tops of the mountains, under every green tree, and under every thick oak, the places where they offered pleasant aroma to all their idols.
verses.ct: Then you will know that I am the LORD — when their dead lie scattered among their idols, surrounding their altars on every high hill, on every mountaintop, under every green tree, and under every thick oak. These were the places where they burned sweet-smelling offerings to all their idols.

verses.kjv: So will I stretch out my hand upon them, and make the land desolate, yea, more desolate than the wilderness toward Diblath, in all their habitations: and they shall know that I am the LORD.
verses.web: I will stretch out my hand on them, and make the land desolate and waste, from the wilderness toward Diblah, throughout all their habitations. Then they will know that I am LORD.’ ”
verses.ct: I will raise my hand against them and turn the land into a wasteland — more desolate than the wilderness near Diblath — everywhere they live. Then they will know that I am the LORD."
